author: Antony Worrall Thompson
method: Preheat the oven to 190C/375F/Gas 5. Melt the butter in a small saucepan.  Add the onions and cook them for about 6 minutes or until they are transparent. Add the herbs, breadcrumbs and seasoning, stirring well to combine everything.   Spoon the stuffing into the cavities of the apples.  Place the apples into a dish, dot the top with butter and put into the oven for about 45-60 minutes. Serve as an accompaniment with pork or duck dishes.
ingredients: 4 large Bramley cooking apples, de-cored and scored,  55g/2oz white breadcrumbs,  225g/8oz onions,  30g/1oz butter,  1 tsp fresh parsley, chopped,  1 tsp fresh sage, chopped,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
